decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, card draw, and utility lands to support the strategy. By efficiently casting spells and utilizing the Phoenix's ability to return to the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the tempo of the game. The inclusion of cards like Treasure Cruise and Opt helps maintain card advantage and ensure a steady flow of spells to enable the Phoenix's recurring presence on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get Arclight Phoenix into play and attacking the opponent. The deck includes several cards to help fill up the graveyard with instants and sorceries, allowing for the Phoenix to return from the graveyard. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. Treasure Cruise is included to help refill the hand with more spells. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game.

This deck focuses on using spells to quickly fill the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. It features low-cost spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Opt to trigger the Phoenix's ability, as well as cards like Picklock Prankster and Lightning Axe to help control the board. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise allows for card advantage and fuel for the Phoenix recursion strategy. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming opponents with quick creatures and efficient spellcasting.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and finish off the opponent with aggressive bursts of damage. The deck includes a variety of cheap spells, card draw, and ways to manipulate the graveyard to ensure a consistent stream of Phoenix activations. Additionally, there are some disruption spells and a few versatile creatures to support the aggro strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, repetitive threats while keeping up card advantage and tempo.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast, efficient creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also utilizing spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to clear the path for attack. The deck's focus is on tempo and card advantage, with cards like Opt, Consider, and Sleight of Hand helping to fuel the graveyard for the Phoenix's revival. Hall of Storm Giants and Otawara, Soaring City provide additional threats, while Treasure Cruise offers a powerful draw engine. Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent provide disruptive elements to keep the opponent off balance.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive Rakdos creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to maintain control of the board while beating down opponents with efficient threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni. With a mix of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, along with powerful finishers like Kroxa and Sheoldred, the deck aims to apply pressure from multiple angles. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of Mutavault provides additional versatility in combat. The goal is to close out games before opponents can stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand. Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide powerful threats, while Fatal Push and Go for the Throat remove opposing creatures. Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway help fix mana consistency, while cards like Blade of the Oni and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide additional threats and resilience. Fear of Missing Out adds pressure on the opponent, and the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and creature aggression, utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Burst Lightning, and Emberheart Challenger to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Manifold Mouse to maintain card advantage and efficiency in dealing damage. The inclusion of cards like Ramunap Ruins and Den of the Bugbear provide additional sources of damage to close out games quickly.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Bishop of Wings, Righteous Valkyrie, and Resplendent Angel, supported by mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. Collected Company allows you to dig for more creatures while also providing instant speed plays. The combination of life gain effects from Giada, Font of Hope and Kayla's Reconstruction help you maintain board presence and outlast your opponent. Skyclave Apparition provides spot removal while Inspiring Overseer pumps up your team.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo. By combining cards such as Monument to Endurance and Sheltered by Ghosts, along with various support cards like Fatal Push and Guardian of New Benalia, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with an unstoppable force. The inclusion of key lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Geier Reach Sanitarium further enhances the deck's consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan.

The key concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Spirit Aggro deck is to utilize a variety of spirit creatures and support spells to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. By taking advantage of the synergies between spirits and utilizing disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Portable Hole, this deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield while efficiently dealing with threats from the opponent. The deck also includes options for card advantage and protection to keep up the pressure and secure victories through a combination of aggression and control tactics.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing cheap spells and card draw to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes. The deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to bring back the Phoenixes from the graveyard and apply pressure to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Artist's Talent, Consider, and Opt allows the deck to dig for specific cards while maintaining a high spell count. Overall, the deck focuses on creating a consistent and aggressive game plan centered around the powerful Arclight Phoenix.

The deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful enchantments and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. By sacrificing smaller creatures to search for key threats or disruptive enchantments, the deck aims to establish board presence and maintain control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Fires of Invention allows for explosive plays while still being able to hold up mana for interaction. The deck's overall game plan revolves around leveraging its resources efficiently to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to take away key cards from your opponent's hand, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board, you can control the flow of the game. Cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide additional threats while Liliana of the Veil can help grind out advantage. Overall, the goal is to control the game and outvalue your opponent.

The deck is focused on assembling the Lotus Field combo, which involves generating a large amount of mana by sacrificing lands. It includes cards like Scapeshift and Nature's Rhythm to search for and play Lotus Field consistently. The deck also includes cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Binding the Old Gods to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With the right setup, the deck can quickly ramp up mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and abilities.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Heartfire Hero, backed up by direct damage spells such as Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. With a focus on speed and efficiency, this deck aims to apply pressure early and never let up, forcing opponents to react quickly or risk being overrun.
